example-learning-objective.text: Prose we want to show up in the lesson.
example-learning-objective.assessment-rec: author notes about how it might be assessed.

sort-count-proglang.text: Sort & count columns of data in the programming environment.

conditionals.text: Identify and explain the three parts of an if-then-else statement, and use it to solve programming problems.

user-events.text: Write functions that handle user input events (key-presses, mouse-clicks, etc.).

model-from-description.text: Identify the state (model) necessary to re-create a program, based on a description (verbal, written, visual, etc).

view-from-description.text: Identify the drawing code (view) necessary to re-create a program, based on a description (verbal, written, visual, etc).

controller-from-description.text: Identify the event handlers (controller) necessary to re-create a program, based on a description (verbal, written, visual, etc).

computing-with-roughnums.text: Explain how the limitations of computers effect computations with very large or very small numbers, and the trade-offs that exist between accuracy and speed.
